1:
The wicked people run away when no one chases them,
\q but righteous people are as bold as a young lion.
\q
2:
Because of the transgression of a land, it has many rulers,
\q but with a man of understanding and knowledge, it will last a long time.
3:
A poor person who oppresses other poor people
\q is like a beating rain that leaves no food.
\q
4:
Those who forsake the law praise wicked people,
\q but those who keep the law fight against them.
5:
Evil men do not understand justice,
\q but those who seek Yahweh understand everything.
\q
6:
It is better for a poor person who walks in his integrity,
\q than for a rich person who is crooked in his ways.
7:
He who keeps the law is a son who has understanding,
\q but one who is a companion of gluttons shames his father.
\q
8:
The one who makes his fortune by charging too much interest
\q gathers his wealth for another who will have pity on poor people.
9:
If one turns away his ear from hearing the law,
\q even his prayer is detestable.
\q
10:
Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way
\q will fall into his own pit,
\q but the blameless will have a good inheritance.
11:
The rich person may be wise in his own eyes,
\q but a poor person who has understanding will find him out.
\q
12:
When there is victory for righteous people, there is great glory,
\q but when the wicked arise, people hide themselves.
13:
The one who hides his sins will not prosper,
\q but the one who confesses them and forsakes them will be shown mercy.
\q
14:
The one who always lives with reverence is blessed,
\q but whoever hardens his heart will fall into trouble.
15:
Like a roaring lion or a charging bear
\q is a wicked ruler over poor people.
\q
16:
The ruler who lacks understanding is a cruel oppressor,
\q but the one who hates dishonesty will prolong his days.
17:
If a man is guilty because he has shed someone's blood,
\q he will be a fugitive until death
\q and no one will help him.
\q
18:
Whoever walks with integrity will be kept safe,
\q but the one whose way is crooked will suddenly fall.
19:
The one who works his land will have plenty of food,
\q but whoever follows worthless pursuits will have plenty of poverty.
\q
20:
A faithful man will have great blessings,
\q but the one who gets rich quickly will not go unpunished.
21:
It is not good to show partiality,
\q but for a piece of bread a man will do wrong.
\q
22:
A stingy man hurries after riches,
\q but he does not know that poverty will come upon him.
23:
Whoever disciplines someone, 
\q afterward will find more favor from him
\q than from the one who flatters him with his tongue.
\q
24:
Whoever robs his father and his mother and says, "That is no sin,"
\q he is the companion of the one who destroys.
25:
A greedy man stirs up conflict,
\q but the one who trusts in Yahweh will prosper.
\q
26:
One who trusts in his own heart is a fool,
\q but whoever walks in wisdom will keep away from danger.
27:
The one who gives to the poor will lack nothing,
\q but whoever closes his eyes to them will receive many curses.
\q
28:
When wicked people rise, men hide themselves,
\q but when wicked people perish, righteous people will increase.
